headline: Classic cheap steakhouse chain closed almost all its restaurants
summary: In my college days in the late 90s, we visited New York City often, but had a fairly limited budget for meals. There were a lot of options. You could get a street vendor hot dog or a large slice of pizza for under $5. You might be able to go to Chinatown and eat for under $10, and fast food was ...

headline: Discount retail chain has closed nearly 700 stores
summary: When times are tight, people trade down. They might take a local vacation or even a staycation instead of getting on a plane, and they may opt for a less nice restaurant, or even cooking for themselves when it comes to meals. That's a trend both McDonald's and Dollar General's CEOs have noted in ...

headline: Trump claims California's $20 fast-food minimum wage hurts businesses. The truth is a lot more complicated
summary: The restaurant industry predicted disaster after California instituted a $20 minimum wage for fast-food workers, but data shows that hasn't happened.

raw.headline: Trump claims California's $20 fast-food minimum wage hurts businesses. The truth is a lot more complicated

headline: Could New Grinch Meal Boost McDonald's (MCD) Holiday Engagement and Brand Differentiation?
summary: McDonald’s has announced a nationwide launch of its limited-edition adult Happy Meal, The Grinch Meal, beginning December 2, 2025, featuring a Big Mac or 10-piece Chicken McNuggets, Dill Pickle "Grinch Salt" McShaker fries, a medium drink, and Grinch-themed socks, in partnership with Dr. Seuss Enterprises. Building on the promotion’s previous success in Canada, this festive campaign leverages pop-culture nostalgia and unique menu items to drive holiday season engagement and differentiate...

headline: IBM Is an AI and IT Leader Set for Growth, Says Analyst. Plus, Lowe’s, Rocket, and More Stocks.
summary: Lowe’s shares are seeing a relief rally, as third-quarter results cleared a very low bar, following weak results out of  Home Depot  Lowe’s comps slightly outperformed its larger peer, with that occurring only once in the prior eight quarters.  There’s upside near $1/share if gross margins get back above 3.25%, which is still far from the pandemic highs of 4.5% when the stock went public.
